nodes.title: Just 50 more!
nodes.description:
Thank you all who have signed and shared! We are only 50 signatures away from reaching our next goal of 500!

Please keep the momentum going!!

Get this woman out of Stanford University!!

nodes.title: Almost to the next tier! Please share
nodes.description:
We are only 14 signatures away from 200! Once we reach 200, Change.org will feature this petition which will in return get us more viewers and recognition. Hopefully getting us more supporters who will sign and share themselves. 

I started this petition only 2 days ago after reading Ms. Dauber's horrible and unprofessional tweets. Although I have no ties to Stanford University, Johnny Depp, Camille Vasquez, or any of the organizations they are tied to, I was infuriated that Michele Dauber was not only allowed to continue her name calling and degrading remarks about Ms. Vasquez, Johnny Depp, and their supporters on Twitter, but that Stanford is evidently turning a blind eye to her public display of sexist remarks, defamation, and name calling.  As I stated in the petition description,  if this was a man making these remarks on social media, he would have been blasted by the public and Stanford University would not have tolerated his behavior. They would have suspended him or fired him immediately.  Why is it okay for a woman to do what a man is not? THIS DOUBLE SIDED STANDARDS AND SOCIAL ACCEPTANCE HAS TO STOP! MALE OR FEMALE, BOTH NEED TO BE HELD ACCOUNTABLE!

PLEASE continue to share the petition link so we can get this petition more visibility and signatures. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR SIGNING, SHARING AND SUPPORTING THIS!!
